definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])

sentences.english: Dip them in vinegar and ginger for a delicious meal.
sentences.chinese: 蘸上醋和姜末制成的调料，便可以开吃了。

definition: to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
to smell, look and taste great
to arrange food on a plate/to plate up/food presentation/(watchmaking) balance wheel
pork chop/pork cutlet/spare ribs/(coll.) skinny person
to rinse/to trick/to fool sb/to cook by dipping finely sliced ingredients briefly in boiling water or soup (generally done at the dining table)
